transcript.text: actually said that if the other three of
us wanted to enter Israel we'd be
allowed to but not my father there were
four of us uh traveling
together and you know if you have a US
passport it's pretty um automatic that
they just stamp your passport and let
you in so the young woman at the
immigration line there
um stamped our
passports all four of
us and then she noticed the name and she
said oh wait a minute um I need to check
something and she took the passports and
went into a back room and stayed there
for a long time and then finally came
back with the passports reamped so where
it said um you know where the entry
stamp was it was stamped over it or
crossed out and then there was a stamp
next to it saying entry denied
